However, I can provide some general information about the trial. Charles J. Guiteau was tried and convicted of the assassination of President James Garfield in 1881. The trial was held in Washington, D.C., where Guiteau shot Garfield on July 2, 1881. Guiteau was executed by hanging on June 30, 1882, in Washington, D.C.
